info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 10:52PM EDT until August 11 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay Ruskin FL
info.description:
FFWTBW
The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Pinellas County in west central Florida...
* Until midnight EDT tonight.
* At 1052 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain showers continued across southwest Pinellas county. Between 5 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Although conditions are improving, it will take time for the water to drain from flooded roadways.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by showers and thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and public reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Seminole, St. Petersburg, St. Pete Beach, Bay Pines, Tierra Verde, Gulfport, Treasure Island, South Pasadena, Madeira Beach, Redington Shores, Redington Beach, Indian Shores, North Redington Beach and Pass-A-Grille Beach.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
